required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics, Safety, and Antiviral Activity of the Elvitegravir/Cobicistat/Emtricitabine/Tenofovir Alafenamide (E/C/F/TAF) Single Tablet Regimen (STR) in HIV-1 Infected Antiretroviral Treatment-Naive Adolescents and Virologically Suppressed Children
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2/3, Open-Label Study of the Pharmacokinetics, Safety, and Antiviral Activity of the Elvitegravir/Cobicistat/Emtricitabine/Tenofovir Alafenamide (E/C/F/TAF) Single Tablet Regimen (STR) in HIV-1 Infected Antiretroviral Treatment-Naive Adolescents and Virologically Suppressed Children

brief_summary.textblock:
There will be 2 cohorts in this study, each consisting of Part A and Part B.
The primary objectives of Cohort 1 are to evaluate the steady state pharmacokinetics (PK) for elvitegravir (EVG) and tenofovir alafenamide (TAF) and confirm the dose of the elvitegravir/cobicistat/emtricitabine/tenofovir alafenamide (E/C/F/TAF) single tablet regimen (STR) (Part A) and to evaluate the safety and tolerability of E/C/F/TAF STR through Week 24 (Part B) in HIV-1 infected, antiretroviral (ARV) treatment-naive adolescents.
The primary objectives of Cohort 2 are to evaluate the PK of EVG and TAF in virologically suppressed HIV-1 infected children 6 to < 12 years of age weighing ≥ 25 kg administered E/C/F/TAF STR (Part A) and to evaluate the safety and tolerability of E/C/F/TAF STR through Week 24 in virologically suppressed HIV-1 infected children 6 to < 12 years of age weighing ≥ 25 kg.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Parameter: AUCtau for EVG (Part A)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 24 hours postdose
primary_outcome.description: AUCtau is defined as concentration of drug over a dosing interval.

primary_outcome.measure: PK Parameter: AUClast for TAF (Part A)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 24 hours postdose
primary_outcome.description: AUClast is defined as the concentration of drug from time zero to the last observable concentration.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Serious Adverse Events (Part B)
Incidence of All Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (Part B)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Plasma HIV-1 RNA < 50 Copies/mL as Defined by the FDA Snapshot Analysis (Part B)
Percentage of Participants with Plasma HIV-1 RNA < 50 Copies/mL as Defined by the FDA Snapshot Analysis (Part B)
Percentage of Participants with Plasma HIV-1 RNA < 400 Copies/mL as Defined by the FDA Snapshot Analysis (Part B)
Percentage of Participants with Plasma HIV-1 RNA < 400 Copies/mL as Defined by the FDA Snapshot Analysis (Part B)
Change from Baseline in Plasma log10 HIV-1 RNA (copies/mL) at Week 24 (Cohort 1 Part B only)
Change from Baseline in Plasma log10 HIV-1 RNA (copies/mL) at Week 48 (Cohort 1 Part B only)
Change from Baseline in CD4+ Cell Count (cells/μL) at Week 24 (Part B)
Change from Baseline in CD4+ Cell Count (cells/μL) at Week 48 (Part B)
Percentage Change from Baseline in CD4+ Cell Count (cells/μL) at Week 24 (Part B)
Percentage Change from Baseline in CD4+ Cell Count (cells/μL) at Week 48 (Part B)
PK Parameter: Ctau for EVG, FTC, TFV, and COBI (Part A)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 24 hours postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Ctau is defined as the observed drug concentration at the end of the dosing interval.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK Parameter: Cmax for EVG, TAF, FTC, TFV, and COBI (Part A)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 24 hours postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Cmax is defined as the maximum concentration of drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK Parameter: Apparent CL for EVG and TAF (Part A)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 24 hours postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent clearance (CL) is defined as the systemic clearance of the drug following oral administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK Parameter: Apparent Vz for EVG and TAF (Part A)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 24 hours postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent Vz is defined as the apparent volume of distribution of the drug after oral administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK Parameter: AUCtau for FTC, TFV, and COBI (Part A)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose and up to 24 hours postdose

arm_group.description: Participants within the ages of 12 and <18 years old will receive E/C/F/TAF STR once daily with food.
Participants within the ages of 6 and <12 years old and weighing ≥ 25 kg will receive E/C/F/TAF STR once daily with food.

intervention.description: E/C/F/TAF tablets contain 150 mg of elvitegravir (EVG), 150 mg of cobicistat (COBI), 200 mg of emtricitabine (FTC), and 10 mg of tenofovir alafenamide (TAF; as 11.2 mg of TAF fumarate)

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Cohort 1
- 12 years to < 18 years of age at baseline
- Weight greater than or equal to 35 kg (77 lbs)
- Plasma HIV-1 RNA levels of ≥ 1,000 copies/mL at screening (Roche COBAS TaqMan v2.0)
- Screening genotype report shows sensitivity to EVG, FTC and tenofovir (TFV)
- No prior use of any approved or experimental anti-HIV-1 drug for any length of time
- Cohort 2
- 6 years to < 12 years of age at baseline
- Weight greater than or equal to 25 kg (55 lbs)
- Plasma HIV-1 RNA of < 50 copies/mL (or undetectable HIV-1 RNA level according to the local assay being used if the limit of detection is > 50 copies/mL) for ≥ 180 consecutive days (6 months) prior to screening on a stable antiretroviral regimen, without documented history of resistance to any component of E/C/F/TAF STR.
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Hepatitis B or hepatitis C virus infection
- Evidence of active pulmonary or extra-pulmonary tuberculosis disease within 3 months of the screening visit.
- Individuals experiencing decompensated cirrhosis
- Pregnant or lactating females
Note: Other protocol defined Inclusion/Exclusion criteria may apply.

facility.name: The HIV Netherlands Australia Thailand Research collaboration (HIV-NAT)
Department of Pediatrics, Faculty of Medicine, Khon Kaen University

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Emtricitabine, Tenofovir Disoproxil Fumarate Drug Combination
